query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Affetto al suo piacer, quel contemplante 2 libero officio di dottore assunse, 3 e cominciò queste parole sante:
query.error: **English:** 1 Affectionate to her pleasure, that contemplative one 2 assumed the free office of a teacher, 3 and began these holy words:
query.result: 1 Affectionate dhe'y pleser, an kontemplys na 2 a gemeras devnydh frank a doctor, 3 ha'y commencas an gerow santow ma:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 «La piaga che Maria richiuse e unse, 5 quella ch’è tanto bella da’ suoi piedi 6 è colei che l’aperse e che la punse.
query.error: **English:** 4 "The wound that Mary closed and anointed, 5 that which is so beautiful from her feet 6 is she who opened it and who pierced it.
query.result: 4 "An wonvos a wrug Mary gwitha ha ena, 5 henna a wra kemmys da a'y throad, 6 yw henna a'y agoras ha'y ponkas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Ne l’ordine che fanno i terzi sedi, 8 siede Rachel di sotto da costei 9 con Bëatrice, sì come tu vedi.
query.error: **English:** 7 In the order that the third seats make, 8 Rachel sits below her 9 with Beatrice, as you see.
query.result: 7 Yn an urdh a wra an tres sedhow gwruthyl, 8 Rachel a wra ow pos a-woles dhe'y 9 gans Beatrice, dell wrug gweles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Sarra e Rebecca, Iudìt e colei 11 che fu bisava al cantor che per doglia 12 del fallo disse ‘Miserere mei’,
query.error: **English:** 10 Sarah and Rebecca, Judith and she 11 who was great-grandmother to the singer who out of grief 12 for his sin said ‘Have mercy on me’,
query.result: 10 Sarra ha Rebecca, Iudith ha henna 11 a veu bysva dhe'n kaner a leveris 12 rag an pechodh ‘Miserere mei’,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 puoi tu veder così di soglia in soglia 14 giù digradar, com’ io ch’a proprio nome 15 vo per la rosa giù di foglia in foglia.
query.error: **English:** 13 you can see descending thus from threshold to threshold 14 down below, as I who by my own name 15 go down through the rose from petal to petal.
query.result: 13 ty a yll gweles ow kodha avel henna a-woles 14 a-woles, dell vy a-woles a-woles gans vy hanow 15 a-woles a-woles an ros a dhalen dhe dhalen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 E dal settimo grado in giù, sì come 17 infino ad esso, succedono Ebree, 18 dirimendo del fior tutte le chiome;
query.error: **English:** 16 And from the seventh level down, just as 17 up to it, succeed Hebrew women, 18 dividing all the petals of the flower;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 perché, secondo lo sguardo che fée 20 la fede in Cristo, queste sono il muro 21 a che si parton le sacre scalee.
query.error: **English:** 19 because, according to the gaze that made 20 faith in Christ, these are the wall 21 at which the sacred stairs are divided.
query.result: 19 rag, herwydh an golwg a wrug gwruthyl 20 an feyth yn Krist, henna yw an wal 21 may yma'n skellow santow ow rannja.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Da questa parte onde ’l fiore è maturo 23 di tutte le sue foglie, sono assisi 24 quei che credettero in Cristo venturo;
query.error: **English:** 22 On this side where the flower is mature 23 with all its petals, are seated 24 those who believed in Christ to come;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 da l’altra parte onde sono intercisi 26 di vòti i semicirculi, si stanno 27 quei ch’a Cristo venuto ebber li visi.
query.error: **English:** 25 on the other side where the semicircles 26 of seats are interrupted, stand 27 those who had their faces turned to Christ already come.
query.result: 25 a'n tuma aral may hy'n hanter-kelliow 26 a wra ow torri gans vowyow, yma'n ow pos 27 henna a wrug tro dhe Krist pan wrug ev dos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 E come quinci il glorïoso scanno 29 de la donna del cielo e li altri scanni 30 di sotto lui cotanta cerna fanno,
query.error: **English:** 28 And as here the glorious throne 29 of the lady of heaven and the other thrones 30 below it make such a great division,
query.result: 28 Ha'gasma henna an tron gloyrus 29 a'y wragydh a'n nef ha'n erel tronyow 30 a-woles ytho avel henna a wra dalleth meur,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 così di contra quel del gran Giovanni, 32 che sempre santo ’l diserto e ’l martiro 33 sofferse, e poi l’inferno da due anni;
query.error: **English:** 31 so opposite that of the great John, 32 who always holy suffered the desert and the martyrdom 33 and then hell for two years;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 e sotto lui così cerner sortiro 35 Francesco, Benedetto e Augustino 36 e altri fin qua giù di giro in giro.
query.error: **English:** 34 and below him thus obtained to be separated 35 Francis, Benedict and Augustine 36 and others down here from circle to circle.
query.result: 34 ha'n-woles ytho avel henna a dhewis orth 35 Fransis, Benedic ha'n Awstin 36 ha'n erel a-woles bysma henna a-dro dhe a-dro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Or mira l’alto proveder divino: 38 ché l’uno e l’altro aspetto de la fede 39 igualmente empierà questo giardino.
query.error: **English:** 37 Now behold the high divine providence: 38 that both the one and the other aspect of the faith 39 will equally fill this garden.
query.result: 37 Mes wruk wela an provyans uhel: 38 rag an unn ha'n erel an aral a'n fydh 39 a wra dalleth leun an jarden ma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 E sappi che dal grado in giù che fiede 41 a mezzo il tratto le due discrezioni, 42 per nullo proprio merito si siede,
query.error: **English:** 40 And know that from the degree down that strikes 41 halfway through the two distinctions, 42 no one sits through his own merit,
query.result: 40 Ha'gas wos an grado a-woles yma's ta'n 41 dhe'n kres an fordh an dew discressyow, 42 rag neb an bewn merit personel yma's sedhys,

query.prompt:

43 ma per l’altrui, con certe condizioni: 44 ché tutti questi son spiriti ascolti 45 prima ch’avesser vere elezïoni.
query.error: **English:** 43 but through someone else’s, with certain conditions: 44 for all these are spirits who were heard 45 before they had true choices.
query.result: 43 mes rag merit erel, gans condistyonow sur: 44 rag an spyrysow oll ma a veu klevys 45 kyns o ve an eleccyow gwir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Ben te ne puoi accorger per li volti 47 e anche per le voci püerili, 48 se tu li guardi bene e se li ascolti.

query.result: 46 Mes ty a all an golla genes dre 47 ha'gas dre'n levow pueril, 48 mar tus a wra wel ha'gas a glew.

query.prompt:

query.prompt:

query.result: 52 Yn-mes an brassa a'n ryalma ma 53 poynt casual nyns eus gallos dhe sevel, 54 mar nyns avel mar trystith po sodh po nawn:

query.result: 58 ha'gas dre henna an bobel festinys 59 dhe'n byw gwir nyns eus heb kawes 60 yntredho pubma moy ha'gas gwell.

64 le menti tutte nel suo lieto aspetto 65 creando, a suo piacer di grazia dota 66 diversamente; e qui basti l’effetto.

148 grazia da quella che puote aiutarti; 149 e tu mi seguirai con l’affezione, 150 sì che dal dicer mio lo cor non parti».

151 E cominciò questa santa orazione:
